definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: In the middle of the 1700s a Frenchman named Epee developed sign language.
sentences.chinese: 在1700年代中期法國人重劍發展了手語。

sentences.english: And I like to use Epee, Kendo , and Broadsword styles.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡使用重劍，劍道以及闊刀風格。

sentences.english: Epee's system used mostly picture image signs.
sentences.chinese: 重劍的系統主要用於圖片形象標誌。

sentences.english: Epee developed a large number of vocabulary words for sign language.
sentences.chinese: 重劍開發了大量的手語詞彙。

sentences.english: I use a heavy sabre in fencing.
sentences.chinese: 在擊劍時用的是把重劍。

sentences.english: Epee taught these words to his deaf students.
sentences.chinese: 重劍教他的這些話聾啞學生。

definition: lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
flight of the roc (used in names)/soaring flight
Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
to charge and break through enemy lines
